comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: One idea running through my head is learning how to design signature codes. Right on this forum, you can see that most of the ranked-up members are already in the signature campaign that is actually paying. If you rank up, you can get lucky enough to be selected in any campaign, and while you contribute positively to the forum, you will be rewarded for your post. Speaking of the signature code design, there are some good designers on this forum, and if you PM any of them, you can possibly hit a deal with them to learn how to make those signature codes, and if you are perfect, it will earn you some money in no time. Nothing good comes easily.

comments.author: Hewlet
comments.body: I believe that if you already have computer skills, getting a soft job that will pay you well shouldn't be a serious problem. The mistake most people make is to look for ways to just earn money online without acquiring the necessary skill that will help them find relevance in the online space. Just like the physical job require you to be skilled, the same is what is applicable in the online space and you also need to be skilled at something and them you can render service to someone in nee and then you get oaid for it.There are lots of soft skill that if you put in the needle effort, it won't take too much time before getting a good paying platform to work with. Some of the soft skill include.1 graphic design2. CPA marketing: I have done this before and if you do it the right way, it pays well3. Copy writing4. You are already in this platform and if you dedicate the right time doing the right thing here, some penny can come inBut what you have to know is that you should dispel and remove any form of getting any financial benefit from whatever soft skill you choose to go into at the onset. Make it a necessity to get the skillset first and with time, money will start coming in.
